channel.title: I think I fried something
channel.description: screenshot says it all... 0.10V / 0.07V I tried to connect a powerbank intenally to the axo +5/GND as discussed in [this post](https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/connecting-axoloti-directly-to-5v-eurorack-rail/3182/3). When I was actually installing the powerbank, I accidentily flipped the on/off switch while also touching some connections or I made a mistake in wiring, unsure, everything seems to be connected ok. There was no other power source connected at the moment of the accident... I removed the batteries, but the powerbank can be seen in the picture, the 5V and GND were connected to the axo 5V and GND. Is this wrong? I used this powerbank this ([youtube]( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a2_RGU-p7N4)) was my axo in action just before the battery surgery that went wrong... can this be fixed? I'm hoping it's a fried fuse or something I did smell something burned while installing, but not a lot, very very faint, and it was gone before I disconnected everything.. --K

item.title: I think I fried something
item.dc:creator: @kaos Kasper Jordaens
item.description:
@kaos wrote:

So yeah, after reading this topic again, and some discussion with a skilled person, it appears that you should not try to power the circuit with 5V if you do NOT cut of the DIN midi part... as is properly described in this post which I obviously did not read good enough before soldering

Connecting Axoloti directly to 5V (Eurorack rail)

@Blindsmyth Thank you, so with a cut off MIDI/power section it appears a direct 5V wired in supply can work. However it's a possibly different situation when the board is intact. It's unclear to me what might happen with the board intact (not cut) because you have now power regulation circuitry which will be floating on the input side and powered on the output side. Looking at the power regulation / supply schematics you can see a few obvious places to think about. Disclaimer: I'm no …

So I'm gonna try and find out what I fried, and if it can be fixed... then powering in a different way.

Read full topic

item.title: I think I fried something
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

Ah i also have another board with this problem. Then Ic4 might be fried.
Can’t really help you on diagnosis, sorry.

You could try to replace that IC, or try the hack that is described in the post you quoted.

Read full topic

item.title: I think I fried something
item.dc:creator: @kaos Kasper Jordaens
item.description:
@kaos wrote:

It sounds like this

Axoloti Core Board Failures Hardware
A few unexpected board failures have been reported, here's the analysis. Scope Affects board revision 1.0, fixed in board revision 1.1 Symptoms: The red LED keeps blinking forever after startup, while green LED is steady on Establishing connection is still possible, but extremely low voltages are reported for the 5V supply and the VDD supply, and patches don't run. IC3 (right behind the output jack) becomes extremely hot (all three!) Failure analysis: While any short on the audio powe…

Is happening...but I really need to find out how to diagnose this correctly

Read full topic

item.title: I think I fried something
item.dc:creator: @kaos Kasper Jordaens
item.description:
@kaos wrote:

The boot up LED sequence is still working, as well as the readout of the serial number. After the boot the red led keeps flashing in a steady, I think 60bpm, pace...

Was that still happening in your case?

Read full topic

item.title: I think I fried something
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

If you had touched one of axolotis gpio pins with 5V you would definately fry the whole board. Happened to one of my boards unfortunately

Read full topic

item.title: I think I fried something
item.dc:creator: @kaos Kasper Jordaens
item.description:
@kaos wrote:

screenshot says it all... 0.10V / 0.07V
I tried to connect a powerbank intenally to the axo +5/GND as discussed in this post.

When I was actually installing the powerbank, I accidentily flipped the on/off switch while also touching some connections or I made a mistake in wiring, unsure, everything seems to be connected ok.

There was no other power source connected at the moment of the accident...

I removed the batteries, but the powerbank can be seen in the picture, the 5V and GND were connected to the axo 5V and GND. Is this wrong?

image.jpg386x858 127 KB

I used this powerbank

image.jpg507x505 96.1 KB

this (youtube) was my axo in action just before the battery surgery that went wrong...
can this be fixed?
I'm hoping it's a fried fuse or something
I did smell something burned while installing, but not a lot, very very faint, and it was gone before I disconnected everything..

--K
